Row.Text: Gallic Wars
Hates barbarians. Likes civilizations that clear out barbarian outposts. Does not like civilizations that ignore barbarian outposts.
I am Caesar, destroyer of conspiracies in the Alpine woods and the Senate alike.
Ambitious. You seek to conquer me before I move on you. I approve.
The die is cast.
A victorious army is one led by a victor.
The danger lies at your very doorstep, and you do nothing.
Tu quoque? Then fall Caesar.
I have Octavian, Antony, and my dear Brutus amongst my friends. And now you!
I can always tell a treacherous friend. Always.
Rome is not without its graces. Come into friendship with us.
I shall be as true a friend to you as my dear Brutus is to me.
You look lean and hungry. Such people are dangerous.
We shall lead them about Rome like we did Vercingetorix!
Gifts are never free.
The gifts of Rome - bread, olive, cheeses, garum. It, as well as my good favor, are said to grant long life.
You had better mean what you say. I, for one, do not make idle threats.
You have a pale and hungry look. I do not much like it. (Denounces You)
Rome lies at the end of all roads, for good or for ill. Will you see it?
It will pass.
Greetings from Rome! We are eager to learn of other lights of civilization in the wilderness. Shall you tell me of yours?
Lend me your ears.
Our interests lie linked like the testudo. Shall we make this formal?
Even a sword tires of smiting.
There will be peace only when I have what is mine to take.
This war saps strength better used against others.
Our empire encompasses thousands of different peoples. Yours will feel at home as they pass through.
Do we let barbarian warriors tramp freely through our lands? No. No we do not.
Shall we agree like orderly people to allow our troops to march in peace towards other lands?
Speak plainly. Are these troops meant for Rome? Shall you call them back to peace or forward to slaughter?
Veto.
So be it.
